title: What do I need to do to get an S+?
body:
So I just played a game of normals on Summoners Rift and played the most broken thing in the game right now. Tank Ekko. It wasn't too hard to get the score that I did (23/0/16), but the thing that triggered me after was the fact that I had only achieved an S- after a game like that. I just don't understand how I can get an S+ when that score only gives me an S-. Please Riot. :( The link is the post game stats to show I did get an S- and that that was my true score line. 

But really, Riot come on. Please.

replies.body:
It isn't a set score you need to achieve, it's all relative to how everyone else on the server is doing with the same champ in the same role.

From Riot:

> It’s based on the champion and role that you just played in a game. So, for example, we look at Annie mid differently to Annie support. We take a series of performance metrics and compare how you do to all other players in your region in your champion / position combination. It is percentile driven - so earning a high score means** you performed in the top x% of players** on that champ in that position. The grade itself governs the point gains.

[(Source)](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/features/champion-mastery)

[Basically grades similarly to a bell curve](http://study.com/academy/lesson/bell-curve-definition-impact-on-grades.html), meaning we have a server full of top lane Ekko gods. 

Riot hasn't released a list of the factors that contribute to a high grade, but I would suggest working on CS, objective assists, and possibly warding to bump up your grade that extra notch ♥

Pretty obvious actually. You took too long to close out the game. If it was under 25 or maybe 30 minutes you would've got an S+ easily. I got one just last night playing nami mid and ended the game nice and quick. Seems pretty easy too me.

You would have gotten it because there are much less players taking Nami mid, so it is easier to get a higher grade. I don't think the time of the game affects it, it seems a lot harder to get a higher grade in a shorter game to my experience. Of course, there's no Riot confirmation on this, so I could be wrong.

Because it's comparing you to every other Ekko top player like Princess Yaia said, it basically is saying there's about ~2-5% players who did a better job. (percentage is a bit of a guess, I read that S+ is the top 2% of players)
